definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: In restless dreams I walked alone narrow streets of cobblestone, neath the hallo of a street lamp.
sentences.chinese: 纷乱的梦中我孤身一人，走在铺满圆石的狭窄小径。

sentences.english: Advocate white is vogue, people need is involute medium halcyon.
sentences.chinese: 崇尚白色是时尚，人们需要纷乱中的宁静。

sentences.english: Standing up, he saw his mother gazing at him from under her dishevelled white hair.
sentences.chinese: 他站起来，看见妈妈的眼睛在纷乱的银发下望着他。

sentences.english: In the hour of perturbation, thou canst not hear the answer to thy prayers.
sentences.chinese: 你心里纷乱的时候，你不能听见神给你的祷告的答应。

sentences.english: But maybe it's possible to clear up some of the confusion.
sentences.chinese: 然而我们或许可以廓清一部分的纷乱。

sentences.english: The troublous feeling is due to the disturbance of outer world.
sentences.chinese: 纷乱的心情，是为了应付外界的干扰而产生的。

sentences.english: The troublous society made a good opportunity for religion spread.
sentences.chinese: 纷乱的社会为宗教的传播提供了良好时机。

sentences.english: We come to a city astir.
sentences.chinese: 我们来到一座纷乱的城市。

sentences.english: There philosophical discoveries still have this power to unsettle the world.
sentences.chinese: 这些哲学发现对纷乱的世界仍有着强有力的影响。

sentences.english: That is the age of political chaos.
sentences.chinese: 那是个政治上呈纷乱状态的时代。

definition: miscellaneous/mixed and disorderly (of writing)/disordered and confusing/mixed-up and illogical
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
to spring up everywhere/from all around
